t: Hear*pn me, Lord,*s my plea is just; listen*ld to my cry. Hear*ln my prayerâ€” it*ld does not rise from deceitful lips.
Let*ln my vindication come from you; may*ld your eyes see what is right.
Though*pn you probe my heart, though*ld you examine me at night and test me, you*ln will find that I have planned no evil; my*ld mouth has not transgressed.
Though*ln people tried to bribe me, I*ld have kept myself from the ways of the violent through*ld what your lips have commanded.
My*ln steps have held to your paths; my*ld feet have not stumbled.
I*pn call on you, my God, for you will answer me; turn*ld your ear to me and hear my prayer.
Show*ln me the wonders of your great love, you*ld who save by your right hand those*ld who take refuge in you from their foes.
Keep*ln me as the apple of your eye; hide*ld me in the shadow of your wings
from*ln the wicked who are out to destroy me, from*ld my mortal enemies who surround me.
They*pn close up their callous hearts, and*ld their mouths speak with arrogance.
They*ln have tracked me down, they now surround me, with*ld eyes alert, to throw me to the ground.
They*ln are like a lion hungry for prey, like*ld a fierce lion crouching in cover.
Rise*pn up, Lord,*s confront them, bring them down; with*ld your sword rescue me from the wicked.

By*ln your hand save me from such people, Lord,*s from*ld those of this world whose reward is in this life. May*ln what you have stored up for the wicked fill their bellies; may*ld their children gorge themselves on it, and*ld may there be leftovers for their little ones.
As*pn for me, I will be vindicated and will see your face; when*ld I awake, I will be satisfied with seeing your likeness.
